meanings.sent1: She wanted to propagate her ideas among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company used social media to propagate their new product.
meanings.sent3: The rumor started to propagate like wildfire in the small town.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for gardening seemed to propagate to everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's passion for reading books began to propagate to her students.

meanings.sent1: The plant will propagate through its seeds.
meanings.sent2: Rabbits can propagate quickly if not controlled.
meanings.sent3: The idea began to propagate in his mind like a virus.
meanings.sent4: The virus can propagate rapidly in crowded areas.
meanings.sent5: The bacteria will propagate in the right conditions.

meanings.definition: To transmit or pass on to others
meanings.sent1: He tried to propagate the message to everyone in the group.
meanings.sent2: The teacher wanted to propagate knowledge to her students.
meanings.sent3: The secret code was difficult to propagate among the spies.
meanings.sent4: The tradition was passed down and propagated through generations.
meanings.sent5: The virus can propagate from person to person if precautions are not taken.
